search_terms.assertion_message: 'hw.bitcast' op result #0 must be Type wherein the bitwidth in hardware is known, but got '!llvm.ptr'

issues.title: [OM] parsing depend on ordering of Class
issues.reason: About class type resolution, but different issue (ordering vs self-reference)

issues.title: [HW] Make `hw::getBitWidth` use std::optional vs -1
issues.reason: About getBitWidth API, but not about self-referential types

issues.title: [Moore] Assertion in MooreToCore when module uses packed union type as port
issues.reason: About union types as ports, different issue

issues.title: [ExportVerilog] Incorrect verilog output for bitcast + zero width aggregate types
issues.reason: About bitcast, but for zero-width types, not overflow

issues.title: [ExportVerilog] Omit bitwidth of constant array index
issues.reason: About bitwidth issues, but for array indices

issues.title: [circt-verilog][llhd][arcilator] Verilog-to-LLVM lowering issues
issues.reason: General LLHD issue, not specific to our bug

issues.title: [FIRRTLToHW] Conversion failure of invalidated wire of clock type
issues.reason: About type conversion, but for clock wires

issues.title: [LegalizeNames] Typedefs need to be checked if they collide with reserved words
issues.reason: About typedef checking, but for reserved words

recommendation.reason: No similar issues found. Search terms (self-referential typedef, circular type, parameterized class, HoistSignals, hw.bitcast, bitwidth overflow) did not match any existing CIRCT issues. The issues found are related to type handling but describe different problems.
